title: The Third Temptation:  Nietzsche's Hammer, Twilight of the Idols, Wagner/Dostoevsky (Coal/Diamonds)
description:
Reggie Gibbs, author of Beyond the Urals,  served in the Marines and studied Russian culture and history. See his full story here (and be sure to read the show notes for a full bio of Reggie):  
https://youtu.be/_Lh-QN2H45o

Here we discuss Nietzsche's insistence on "hardness" and the will to power as contrasted with Dostoevsky's work which showcases the terrible destinies that await those who go to such places. We focus on Nietzsche's comparison between coal (soft) and diamonds (hard) and those he felt typified soft (Wagner) and hard (Dostoevsky).
